fields.description:
I've been running into issues on certain page wizards where I hit the Cancel button and the required fields are still checked and I have to hit the Cancel button a second time for it to work.  What I'm experiencing is, you have to click on the page first in order for the required field check to happen, then hit the Cancel button to get the Cancel occur.  If you just hit the Cancel button immediately after the page loads, then the check is done first.  The pages I've seen this happen are on the Auto Scaling wizard and the Security Groups wizard.

To reproduce:
1. Start the Auto Scaling or Security Group wizard.
2. Immediately after the first wizard page finishes loading, click the Cancel button.
fields.summary: Required fields should not be checked if a user clicks the Cancel button

comments.body: I can confirm this... abide validation looks like it is getting in the way. unsure why

This is due to the input field being autofocused when the modal is loaded. So, the first click on the Cancel button, or any field on the modal, is registered as a click-away from the input field where the required field is left empty, thus the validation picks up the error. On the second click on the cancel, which is the actual click works and triggers no validation.

This issue has been pointed out at the end of 4.0 release, but it seems like there is no workaround for this issue at the moment.
This should really be no validation whatsoever when clicking cancel, not just required fields...

in debugging the abide code, I find that it is a blur event that causes validation. There is no information passed to the blur listener that would let us determine if the cancel link is clicked. No information about the new focus target, just the blurred target. Seems like a dead-end. I've posted on the foundation forum where people posted other "suggestions" which don't work for us (and not sure how they work for them!)

I discovered another neat feature where you specify data-abide='ajax' and we can then use our own submit listener (I think).

One option for this problem is to not use automatic abide validation, but install our own which may or may not leverage abide manually. I think that's out of scope for 4.0.1.

ok, wow. I hacked up something in foundation.abide.js that make it "work". The form must specify a cancel-target selector, so I could specify; cancel-target=".cancel-link" and this: Cancel would bypass validation. This hack works by listening to "blur" and simply saving the blur target if "cancel-target" was defined. In that case, it also sets up a focus listener for every other target (except the cancel-target), under the form, and that's where validation gets called now. Not sure we should rush into using this.
Awesome! However, I agree that we will need to be careful for the fixes that involve the direct modification of the foundation code. Re-scoping this issue for 4.1 would make sense to me as well.
Probably not 4.1, but 4.0.2 would make sense if it's high risk and touches a lot of code. Let's push it out of 4.0.1.

Perhaps I should change the summary of this bug.  It's not so much that the fields are being checked when you hit the cancel button but they are being checked when you click anywhere on the page.  Perhaps they should only be checked when you start typing in the fields themselves or hit the submit button.

On Submit is how we used to do it in 3.4.x, to avoid this very issue. Live validation is the modern thing to do nowadays, but it's not really ripened to the point where the user experience is frankly as good as it was before. 

Validation on keyup is even more annoying if you can imagine. It does things like tell you you haven't met the minimum requirements like for CIDR IP structures when you are in the middle of typing them. It makes you want to scream "I KNOW! SHUT UP, COMPUTER!" at your screen. :)

Right now it's primarily annoying if you click cancel, or if you click another link like "Create key pair" or "Create security group" from the wizards. We should focus this bug on those really annoying things that users are likely to hit if we want to keep using Foundation's built-in validation, which is what is doing the live validation.
let's just check in 4.1 and be sure that clicking cancel cancels without checking validation. If there's more work to be done let's do it.
investigate.. Kamal added fix to master template.

The very case in the description still fails. [~kgill], what cases does the listener in master_layout.pt fix? It looks to me like that disables a change checker at the window level, but still doesn't address the abide validation which interferes as focus leaves the field. (linking to my foundation.abide.js patch: https://gist.github.com/dkavanagh/32874d28420cabc90816)
[~dkavanagh]: The fix in master_layout was for the "Are you sure you want to leave this page.." behavior, which isn't within the scope of GUI-1127.  Sorry for the confusion.

I tested with the current foundation "master" and it looks like the problem has gone away! Inspecting the code, it seems like abide checking logic has been changed to address this type of thing. We should upgrade Foundation immediately in the 4.2 early stages. I'm kicking this out of 4.1 ([~jloza])

[~dkavanagh]: We had a ticket open for upgrading Foundation (GUI-1169), but we opted to kick it out of 4.1 due to numerous regressions.  Let's discuss during our 4.2 planning summit how we want to tackle the upgrade.

I checked on the foundation.abide.js changes and there are many adjustments in that part of the code, so it is hard to isolate those that fix this. I'd rather not incorporate my patch for this since it not done the same way as the foundation changes. It would be good to hold off on this till we can properly update foundation. The diff between our foundation.abide.js and the current one is about 300 lines long.
Does Foundation upgrade fix this? if so I am OK with waiting.
yes. When I tested it did.
Hm, OK. Let's upgrade foundation in 4.2 then and not fix this one. Thanks, [~dkavanagh]!
Fixed by GUI-1478
